speaker: George Shields
transcript: No that's exactly right. And so the problem that most theoreticians have when they read experimental papers is they don't know what the error bars are. It's a mistake. I mean because you need to know whether you've got an overlap between the theory and the experiment so that you know that you're you have confidence that you're basically getting it and what your error bars are when you do a simulation or whatever it is. speaker: Matt Green
transcript: One idea I have or one problem I see is we still we keep thinking about capture and conversion or storage as two separate ideas. You know you do your capture and then you feed whatever you captured off to some other process.
